sub_topic: Determining the length of a diagonal in a rectangular prism.
message_1: A rectangular prism has a length of 10 cm, a width of 8 cm, and a height of 6 cm. What is the length of the diagonal of this rectangular prism? (Round off your answer to the nearest hundredth).
message_2:
To find the length of the diagonal of a rectangular prism, we can use the 3D Pythagorean theorem. The formula is:

Diagonal = √(length² + width² + height²)

Plugging in the given values:

Diagonal = √(10² + 8² + 6²)
Diagonal = √(100 + 64 + 36)
Diagonal = √200

Rounding off to the nearest hundredth, the length of the diagonal is approximately 14.14 cm.
